metadata.title: CVE-2016-4583 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
WebKit in Apple iOS before 9.3.3, Safari before 9.1.2, and tvOS before9.2.2 allows remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy and obtainimage date from an unintended web site via a timing attack involving an SVGdocument.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4583` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
webkit2gtk package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
